botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts are toxic if ingested. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Digitalis can be biennials or usually short-lived perennials forming a rosette of simple leaves with bell-shaped flowers in slender, erect, usually one-sided racemes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Will grow in almost any soil or situation except very wet or very dry; ideally a sheltered, warm site with humus-rich soil in light or partial shade. See foxglove cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed. Sow in August or September for flowers the following year, or in late winter at 15-18°C for flowers the same year. Plants may self-seed, but may not come true unless grown in isolation
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead main spike as flowers fade, to encourage lateral shoots with more flowers
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, leaf and bud eelworms, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, downy mildews and leaf spot
